author: Special Correspondent
text:
V. Kumar, programme coordinator of the Krishi Vigyan Kendra, Puducherry, receiving the Best Scientist Award from UP Tourism Minister Om Prakash Singh in Varanasi —photo: special Arrangement

V. Kumar, programme coordinator-cum-principal in the Perunthalaivar Kamaraj Krishi Vigyan Kendra in Puducherry has been conferred with the Best Scientist Award by the Indian Society of Extension Education, New Delhi.

He was recently presented the award by UP Tourism Minister Om Prakash Singh at a national seminar hosted by the Society at Banaras Hindu University in Varanasi.

Mr. Kumar, with over 17 years of expertise in extension education, has led efforts in transferring to the field the latest technologies in agriculture and allied areas such as horticulture, animal husbandry and fisheries. His efforts for the betterment of the farming community had won him the Best KVK Award for 2005-06 from the Indian Council of Agriculture Research. Chief Minister N. Rangasamy also felicitated the KVK officer.
